sen.j: 応仁記（おうにんき）は、室町時代の歴史書である。
sen.e: The Onin-ki is a historical work of the Muromachi period.
The Onin-ki is a historical work of the Muromachi period.
The Onin-ki is a historical work of the Muromachi period.

sen.j: 足利将軍家や畠山氏、斯波氏の家督争いなどから発展した「応仁の乱」を中心に、その原因と洛中の合戦の様子や東軍細川勝元と西軍山名持豊(宗全)の死までが記されている軍記物語。
sen.e: It is a war tale focused on the 'Onin War' that developed out of the succession disputes within the Ashikaga Shogunal family, the Hatakeyama clan, and the Shiba clan, recounting it from its causes, through all the battles fought in and around the capital, up until the deaths of Katsumoto HOSOKAWA of the eastern forces and Mochitoyo (Sozen) YAMANA of the western forces.
sen.cmt: 足利将軍家の「将軍」は形容詞に近いのでthe Ashikaga Shogunal familyとしました。
sen.e: It is a war chronicle focusing on the Onin War that developed out of inheritence disputes within the Ashikaga Shogunal family, the Hatakeyama clan, and the Shiba clan, recounting everything from its origins, through all the battles fought in and around the capital, up until the deaths of Katsumoto HOSOKAWA of the eastern forces and Mochitoyo (Sozen) YAMANA of the western forces.
sen.cmt: I didn't think "tale" captured the nuance of 「軍記物語」 so I changed it to "chronicle". Changed "focussed" to "focussing", "succession disputes" to "inheritance disputes" and "recounting it from its causes" to "recounting everything from its origins" as I felt these made the sentence read a little more naturally, and that including "everything" captured the meaning of the Japanese better.. Also took "Onin War" out of quotation marks as I didn't feel they were necessary.
sen.e: It is a war chronicle focusing on the Onin War that developed out of inheritance disputes within the Ashikaga Shogunal family, the Hatakeyama clan, and the Shiba clan, recounting everything from its origins, through all the battles fought in and around the capital, up until the deaths of Katsumoto HOSOKAWA of the eastern forces and Mochitoyo (Sozen) YAMANA of the western forces.

sen.j: 全３巻で、各種の諸系統本がある。

sen.j: 「太平記」の影響を受け、漢字カタカナ交じり文。
sen.e: It was influenced by the 'Taiheiki' (The Record of the Great Peace), and written in a mixture of kanji and katakana.

sen.j: 成立年は15世紀末から16世紀中ごろと諸説ある。
sen.e: There are various theories about when it was written, ranging from the end of the 15th century to the mid-16th century.

sen.j: その内容は、室町時代の末期の応仁元年（1467年）から文明 (日本)9年（1477年）の10年余りにわたり、都とその周辺で争われ、荒廃させた戦乱を描き、梁の宝誌和尚作と伝えられている『野馬台詩』末六句に予言された「修羅闘諍」の世界を描写する意図があったと考えられる。
sen.e: The contents cover more than ten years at the end of the Muromachi period, from 1467 to 1477, describing the wars fought in and around Kyoto that devastated the capital, perhaps with the intention of describing the world of 'pandemonium and fighting' prophesied in the last six lines of the "Yamatai shi" (Poem on Japan) said be the work of the Liang monk Baozhi.

sen.cmt: Added "a span of" "the contents cover" to make the sentence read a bit more smoothly, removed comma after "Muromachi peroid" as it seemed uneccessary. Took "Yamatai shi" out of apostrophes. Also replaced "describing the wars" with "and describe the wars" to prevent the repetition of "describing".

sen.j: それを作者の自らの解釈を交えながら、乱による荒廃した都、その哀惜や悲嘆、乱の原因から戦闘場面に移る克明な描写。
sen.e: It depicts in vivid detail the devastated capital and the griefs and laments of war, from the causes to the scenes of fighting, while mixing in the author's own interpretations.

sen.j: 最後は「都鄙遠境共ニ修羅道トゾ成ニケル。」で終わる。
sen.e: It ends by saying, 'From the city and the country to lands far away, all has become pandemonium.'

sen.j: このようなことから、この応仁の乱を熟知し、何らかの関与をしていた人物で武家の戦乱の無意味さを嘆いた出家した僧か公家が作者ではないかとも思われる。
sen.e: From all this, the author is thought to have been someone who was familiar with the Onin War and had some sort of involvement in it, perhaps a monk or court noble who had taken Buddhist orders and lamented the meaninglessness of the warriors' conflict.
